summary: This is a service request ticket for programming and adding Vicon V942 IP cameras to Qognify at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated September 28, 2019. The request was assigned to Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie for camera configuration assistance.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to handle the service request for programming cameras at the MCC New York facility.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Assigned alongside Jeff Cranor to handle the camera programming service request.

connections.description: Both assigned to the same service request for camera programming at the MCC facility.

events.title: Camera programming service request
events.description: Service request created for programming Vicon V942 IP cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York to allow connectivity to Sitebuilder.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, MS0109, NEW YORK, NY 10007
keyFacts: This document is a service request for programming security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The request was made on September 28, 2019, and assigned to technicians Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie.
The specific need was to program the correct ONVIF HTTP Port number in Vicon cameras to allow connectivity to Sitebuilder software.
The document shows maintenance activity at the MCC facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held before his death.
No direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or any specific inmates is made in this technical service ticket.
